website_summaries.verdict: With a weight capacity of 300 pounds, this reasonably priced roller stand is a versatile addition to the workshop that can handle multiple types of feed jobs.
pros: Works with band saws, table saws, and more thanks to its adjustability
cons: It's not up to some of the extremely heavy-duty work that roller stands with higher weight limits can handle

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-made intelligently designed adjustable stand. In the short time that I've owned the stand, it has performed perfectly and appears as though it will last for years to come. I would recommend this to other professionals who like quality built tools.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick GreenGuy Wright

customer_reviews.title: Underrated as a solid roller stand
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these as infeed/outfeed support for my table saw. The heavy construction and smoothness of the rollers make these things solid and dependable in use. The "wedge" shape of the main column keeps it from sliding downwards the moment you loosen the screw, which is a VERY nice feature for getting it at just the right height. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gatliff

customer_reviews.title: Dependable pedestal for your longer work pieces
customer_reviews.text: I like the wedge design of the lift column - no more slipping or accidental lowering while you're working! The unit is very sturdy though I wish the floor leveling system were the more traditional screw type - the one provided works, but is limited in adjustment. Truthfully, if you need to adjust things that much, you should find a more level place to put the pedestal. The three head option is nice, though I've only used the roller and flat stand. Easy to put together once you decipher the instructions. Overall, I recommend this unit and have purchased two for my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate specifications
customer_reviews.text: Seems nice but no way does this go up to 43 inches like the description says. It will work out after I make a new riser for it but disappointing that it does not perform to the description.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, if challenging to assemble
customer_reviews.text: A nicely finished, well made product that took a few tries to assemble correctly - but once done I bought a second. This is an excellent addition to a cramped, busy woodshop.
customer_reviews.author: designinca

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these stands and of the units received one does what it is supposed to and the other was manufactured in a way that prevents one of the legs from folding out. I contacted the manufacturer for a replacement leg and had to follow up with them multiple times before they finally got a replacement shipped. Had I not followed up, it was clear that no progress would have ever been made. It has now been a month since I received the two units from Amazon and I still only have one that is able to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Galt

customer_reviews.title: It is OK, not great
customer_reviews.text: I think the price is a little high for this product. It is OK, but the fit and finish as well as functionality is not great. It works OK, but I can't say I'm overly satisfied. I get plenty of use out of it, but I don't believe I would purchase again. I think there are cheaper options that would function just as well. Mostly, the quality doesn't reflect the cost. Feel like something you'd find at Harbor Freight - not the cheapest option in the store, but they're "higher-end" model.
customer_reviews.author: dmwbnd

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This stand is exactly what I was looking for. It is solid and well constructed. It is very easy to assemble and easy to adjust. I would recommend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma traveler

customer_reviews.title: Must-have accessory for a table saw or workbench
customer_reviews.text: Who hasn't struggled to balance a work piece that was much larger than your work surface? This roller stand is the answer. Easy to assemble, easy to set up and adjust the height. The three-function head (stationary support, uni-directional roller, multi-directional ball rollers) make it perfect for any type of work.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Strong like bull
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the flat roller and multiple round rollers and because I didn't want to: buy another piece of junk from Harbor Freight and didn't want to pay $150. for a grown up one. This is a good compromise and should do everything I expect from it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: The Bora Portamate was received without any shipping damage. The product was well packaged and the instructions were very well written. My only objection is that I want to use this with my bandsaw as a support arm. To bring the roller to a level with the table of my 14" bandsaw, it places the roller at the end of the extension, meaning that is no place to go further up. Would like to see a longer extension for support and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is my first item of this type. I cut rabets in long (8 ft) melamine boards on my radial arm saw.This product made the job very manageable for one person. Decent price, well made and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Cripe

customer_reviews.title: Great three way roller
customer_reviews.text: Great roller stand. The wedge design for the shaft should be standard for all rollers.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Green

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Very well designed. Nice and sturdy. I bought 2. I use them a lot. They are a huge help. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Raybo

customer_reviews.title: Another great product
customer_reviews.text: I have several Bora tools they really make great products for the money. Very sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.author: dnr50

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I bought 2 of these for support while using my table saw. My only complaint is they could be a bit heavier. A couple times they wanted to tip when the wood hit them.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew icenbice

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a lightweight third hand.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Good value for a lightweight roller. True to the description.
customer_reviews.author: Junej

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up but not super stable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and setup permanently in front of my table saw. The only weakness is that it can wobble so you need to be sure the next thing your wood is on is very stale.
customer_reviews.author: MRD

customer_reviews.title: the size and conveince of portability
customer_reviews.text: i like the roller stands of course i am using them for small hobby type projects if i were doing different type work these may be a little unstable for larger pieces of wood
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and workshop
customer_reviews.text: The best work stand I've ever owned. I love that it's easily adjustable and multi-purpose it's just a great asset to have
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked just like I expected
customer_reviews.text: Put this together when I received it and used it the next day. Worked just like I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Delta Romeo Golf

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful around the shop. I love the tapered shaft so that it can't slip down after it's tightened. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Best stand since Steven King's....
customer_reviews.text: great price point and functionality. I really appreciate the 3-way head, and the tapered main post keeps height adjustment where you set it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Height hard to adjust
customer_reviews.text: The stand is stable, easy to assemble, however accurately adjusting the height is difficult. I recommend a stand which is adjustable with a crank and screw mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: SOB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese Garbage
customer_reviews.text: It seems like this thing would work well in theory but the execution is poor to say the least. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, set up and storage.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it alot, setup is fool proof and stores easy
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Green

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price. Pedestal a bit lite weight. Used hand weight to hold in place. Roller option nice
customer_reviews.author: Ed Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Wedge does not work as intended
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I've had these for about 6 months with light use and the wedges have deflected under pressure from the screw handle to the point that these do not stay up under any kind of weight. They are absolutely useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C Sorci

customer_reviews.title: Handy Helper
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my table saw to assist with cutting large boards, and they have been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of junk. If you are going to make things for pros, at least make them to be tough. We are men here tightening things not little infants. The weld popped the first time it was turned.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: A must for working with a table saw. NOT- Changed my review from 5 to 2
customer_reviews.text: The unit took me about 5 minutes to assemble. it is really sturdy and the large ball bearings make it very easy and safe to move cut pieces off of my table saw. I had been using adjustable saw horses for a very long time and decided I wanted something that was far less hassle but was easy to store. This product does exactly what I wanted. The only thing I would love to see is a way to adjust the legs so they will work better on uneven surfaces. Ironically, the unit just broke after I wrote the review. The captive nut holding the adjustment handle/bolt broke off. Underneath it was totally rusty
customer_reviews.author: bookluvr

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but QC issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. They work fine for me. The first one had a nut that stripped. I contacted the company and they sent me a new set of hardware which was missing the nut that I needed. I then received the other stand and it was missing both nuts too. Took me a while to use them because of this so that's why I took off a star.
customer_reviews.author: J Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great value
customer_reviews.text: I used these for feeding a table saw. They worked great and look really nice and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The Taper Wedge System is sloppy and requires multiple turns to lower. Its not worth a second look.
customer_reviews.author: Zeb H. Steinberg

product_meta.title: BORA Portamate PM-5093 Tri Function Pedestal Roller 11.25" Polished Steel Roller, Ball Bearing Multi-Directional Rollers
product_meta.description: The Portamate PM-5093 pedestal roller solves many woodworker's needs for stable support and freedom of movement when working with larger work pieces. With a deluxe pivoting head it features 3 types of work support - an 11.25" polished steel ball bearing roller, a 6-ball multi-directional roller, and a stationary support. Easy to assemble, it will fold Flat for convenient storage. Non-slip rubber feet and a wide footprint ensure stability. Durable powder coat finish and a high strength ABS height adjustment handle with Column wedge Lock feature. With height adjustment from 27" to 43-3/4" (686mm to 1.1M) it is ideal for use with Table saws, drill presses and other shop machines. Its heavy duty 300Lb (136kg) load capacity allows you to take on the day.
feature_bullets: Three types of support – perfect for any application, you can have a roller support, multi-directional ball support, or rigid stationary support.
Fully adjustable - adjusts from 27" to 43-3/4" (686mm to 1.1M), making it ideal for table saws, band saws and similar.
Extra strong with a 300 lb. (136kg) capacity – it will hold the heavy stuff, and stay stable, with a tough powder coat finish and non-slip feet.
Folds away for easy storage – makes it easy to setup and move.
11 ¼” polished steel roller and six-ball multi-directional rollers – any type of feed application is handled, as well as stationary support.
